subject: feat(import): accept `target:` as alias for `to:` in connections + improve AI output guide
body:
Parser now accepts both `to:` and `target:` in frontmatter connections blocks.
AI models frequently produce `target:` despite the guide specifying `to:`,
causing silent data loss on import. Both keys now work, with `to:` taking
priority when both are present.

Guide improvements based on real-world AI output testing:
- Added context section explaining what the output becomes (visual graph)
- Emphasized `to:` field requirement (not `target:`)
- Added guidance to create headings for all wiki-linked entities (avoid stubs)
- Strengthened connection labels guidance (default: always include one)
- Added Unicode characters note (use actual chars, not escape sequences)

Tags: import, guide, connections, ai-output
Complexity: 2
Urgency: 3
Impact: user-facing
Risk: low
Debt: paid
Epic: ai-research-output
Semver: minor
